Description: Fragment of double handle at neck join from a Koan pottery transport amphora. Clay medium red-brown; some large inclusions; green-cream slip. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Virginia Grace misread or misplaced this stamp. It is from the same die as Alexandria Museum AUG 977, which she allocated to her type 545 (see 1955,0920.36). The reading Σαμ[ is to be found, from a different die, on Alexandria Museum ABC 534, her type 806, for which this is the fullest example.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0138)
